GRMj70Eslgc-AMwccyRz2g.text: Lovely looking place inside, felt relaxed. The music was just a little loud and coffee quite strong. There wasn't a big selection of Danish pastries for breakfast but I guess that's not really what you come here for, the breakfast menu looks fantastic! Would come here again to try the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom

-01uTDF5tWXcU66rbv96yQ.text: I am rather impressed by Joe's Kitchen. There is ample seating in the warm and well designed restaurant. Service was prompt and friendly, whilst the menu is a catalogue of breakfast superstars. Will I go for pancakes or a full English? One thing for sure was I had to try the breakfast smoothie. It was delicious.I eventually opted for the croque monsieur. It was awesome. It had lovely crème cheese which you don't always get. I was in cheesy bread heaven. My two compatriots also looked very happy with their choices. At £9 for my smoothie and breakfast I felt I had decent value for money. Joe's is no greasy spoon, it is an excellent breakfast restaurant.I will definitely be back.

Ow-uMMmlRgQXQQ6ffV2YVA.text: I've  been by this place a thousand times on the bus and decided to finally go there on my last trip to Borough Market. It did not fail.Joe's has a clean, well lit open seating dining room. The decor is nice and tasteful, as is the lighting. The staff is very attentive and professional. The service is timely and one is not rushed to free up a table for the next group.Most importantly the food was wonderful. I had their version of eggs Benedict. It was great. The eggs were cooked to perfection and the sauce was perfect. The eggs came on a bed of potatoes the were something like a latke. The portion size was right as well.Joes has a huge selection of fresh juices and shakes. If you are going to Borough Market and want a respite from the noisy crowded atmosphere that can be a little hectic and overwhelming, eat at Joe's! I will again.

USUWCESdArdB9h6EvKbysA.text: A friend of mine invited me here for lunch and of course I went. In addition I've never eaten here so I had to try it. The food was good and the service was on a satisfying level. However, some of the staff tend to procrastinate and I did not like that.

zFlaHeWzdMlxrKFnWbpJuQ.text: Amazing, beyond all reason! Fair prices, large portions, delicious food--all difficult things to find in London! I've been here for both brunch and dinner multiple times, and the food is always excellent. The queue for Saturday and Sunday brunch can get quite lengthy, but it is worth the wait!

VTt9ceLmm5np5szNggDw8A.text: Joe's Kitchen is a funky restaurant just moments around the corner from Borough tube station. The serve a mixture of American (Burgers for examples) and British dishes with a modern twist. The menu resembles what you would find in a pub, but better quality, smaller portions, and higher prices.The décor is modern and you would be happy bringing a business client here for lunch. Last time I was here I ordered a steak pie and mashed potato. Unfortunately I was disappointed as the mash was included inside the pie itself. This meant that the dish was much smaller than expected, although costing almost £10. They have two beers on tab (Stella and Petermans when I last visited), although there are also bottled beers available plus a wine list which I have not yet sampled. The restaurant is fairly large, and they also have some tables with benches which are suitable for groups of ~10 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom

hYdrh_HnkcBY1DaDA3XQKQ.text: On my hunt for the best American-style pancakes in London that a South African can find I found Joe's Kitchen. The pancakes on my Sunday brunch expedition were the best I've had in London so far! (Crispy bacon and fresh fruit yum) Joe's have a weeknight 20% off deal which enticed me there again for some nighttime pancake good time. Kudos to the chef for making them despite them not being on the night menu. Only downside was that they were a bit stodgy compared to the first time. Still, def recommended!

fs3g4gdBQ7cUE7On9tqGLg.text: Full Disclosure - I'm an American living in London, take that for what it's worth.Ambiance:  I went here for a lunch on a Wednesday afternoon after having walked by countless times.  The decor is my style, laid back and has some kinda old antique-y type clocks and signage.  Large specials blackboard that looked like it got a lot of use, which is a good thing.Food/Drink:  Had a fresh squeezed lemonade, served with a mint sprig.  It was large, sweet, refreshing and delicious.  Was intrigued by the Bubble and Squeek on the menu, but the American in me steered me towards the chilli (it has been months since I've had a good bowl).  The bowl was served with brown rice on the side (eh, not a fan so much of brown rice in general), tortilla chips and sour cream.  The chilli was the perfect constancy, not too thick, right amount of chunks.  Tossed in the chips and sour cream and it was on like donkey kong.  Great flavor (flavour these days?) and quite filling.Final thoughts:  I'd definitely recommend this place for a quick bite and will stop in for breakfast before I have to leave for the states.  Maybe I'll get some kind of "bangers" or squeek or whatever.

dC3sYW9uv3Na0EnXF8X_4g.text: Food quality is very uneven. I often get overcooked meals. The service is terrible which is a surprise because the place looks very nice. I keep going there because it's closest to my flat and always promise never to return.

xBlQZun6nzl7Y4DwZu_pZQ.text: I have been on a quest for the past two years ... to have the best french toast that i could possibly have in London. To that end i have travelled from 202 restaurant in the West to the Diner in the East ... from Pavement in the South to Ottolenghi in the North. However the best so far has been at the Joe's Kitchen, which is barely a 15 minute walk from my home.The French toasts here are very much like what i remember from my childhood days. Plain bread fried with eggs ... without any sweetener added. If you want it to be sweet, you can add the cinnamon or the maple syrup yourself, and that is delicious at Joe's.Given that i have a habit of picking up food from the plates of my friends, i have also ended up trying the scrambled eggs (nice), omelette (delicious) and parts of the american breakfast (pretty much the english one, but with pancakes). The food has been good all along. If you fancy a drink, try the juices ... they are as fresh here as they can get.But the best part of Joe's Kitchen is the ambience and layout. It never feels as crowded as Ottolenghi, or as cramped as the Diner or most pubs. The tables are spread out thin, in a rather large area.Breakfast here costs about as much as most comparable places. You can have a big breakfast for about £15 per person. Its totally worth a repeat visit.

6feSLsANzDCuzwD2uVU1fQ.text: As mentioned in my previous review, I have always not been a fan of Joe's service. But after my last two visits of surly looks and brusque service, Joe has gotta go in my brunch book.

u70FUQMl_1uU9kAerBPeMg.text: I've only been to Joe's on the weekend for breakfast, when it caters to the Borough yuppie crowd with a menu targeting the increasing popularity of American-style brunch fare.  The food is solid with a focus on good quality and the pricing at around 8-10pounds for the full English breakfast is fair for what you get. The decor is pleasant and woodsy and reminds me of the sorts of popular brunch chains frequented by urban professionals that you see in any big North American city. In a neighbourhood where crowds can be tough to avoid, Joe's almost always has a large and roomy table and I'd recommend it if you're in the area with a group small or large. The food is consistent and of good quality and covers all the brunch basics!

lSAVznB6ajaFKdJUXHQv2Q.text: Eat At Joe's!!!The coffee in London is much better than in the US because they use an expresso machine to make their coffee.  A nice rich flavor.  I had the Fry Up which had Eggs, baked beans, sausage, bacon and fried bread which is toast that's fried on the flattop instead of toasted.  This meal was exceptionally good and is a good start to your day.  My friends had an eggs scrambled dish and the eggs were fluffy and good.

1utkMVoUS1gAx9rOSWXrOQ.text: I love this place and visit almost once a week. Really nice setting and well thought out menu. I wish it opened in the evening. I have only given this 3 stars because the service and food standard sometimes drops. Very inconsistent.

vr-5ePhfXEpKaBApcLkEZQ.text: I went here for breakfast one sunday, it was great! I'm really addicted to poached eggs and holondaise sause so I was really exited to see their bubble and squeek with poached egg and holondaise sause. The atmosphere was friendly and everyone seemed to be very happy. The bright decor and wooden floor created a nice bubbly morning for us. The one disapointment was with the coffee. The cappuccino was excessivly bitter and the milk was over heated like most places and built up like a castle. If they just popped down the road to Monmouth coffee roasters and got some advice I'm sure this place would be perfect! Overall a great place.

ZVVX5t0S-Yx3RNIAPyxgzA.text: Having only been to Joe's Kitchen for breakfast and brunch I can only give a rating for those options. The wooden tables and old school chairs give it a lovely homely feel and the staff are very helpful with a couple of outstanding waitresses who make all the difference. The service is very dependent on the weather though, on a sunny weekend expect it to be packed out by 11am, unfortunately the level of service goes down considerably during these busy times and the place sometimes seems to be desperately short staffed. Overall I enjoy the convenience and slow pace of Joes, a lazy morning spent reading the Sunday papers and drinking multiple lattes is my idea of a day well spent, if you like the same then head over there with a mild hangover and you'll feel much better by the time you leave.

AHEeA-9qgd0rMaQrh5uXQQ.text: I had the mac and cheese. Was ok but not amazing. Hubby had the BBQ chicken special and was very mediocre. The 'milkshake of the day' was blueberry and vanilla and that was pretty nice. We found it to be overpriced though. I was disappointed not to have had the same experience as others see to have had.

NnhB85ISKVGO6Quom3w1uQ.text: if you tire of the costly and crowded places to eat around borough market, this place will give you what you need. basic good food on large plates with efficient service, the weekend papers to read and a cosy atmosphere. unfortunately it closes at 2pm on weekends but long enough to warm you if you are braving the crowds thames side.

xV_T2w0qbOLhu-_Pem9YSQ.text: The staff are really nice and helpful, will accommodate for any special requests you have. The restaurant is also very nice, clean and relaxed. Makes good for a relaxed breakfast or lunch with friends.Coffee wise it's quite good, served at a good drinkable temperature straight away which always is a big plus for me. My friend wanted hers a bit warmer, and that was no issue!Food is great and served in fairly large portions, there's a lot of bang for your buck.

Gx7tH0EgkxZEMBVb0HenfQ.text: I've come to Joe's on two separate occasions and have ordered the same thing both times: the pancakes with strawberries and bananas and bacon.  This diner is right around the corner from where I live and yes, the ambience is fun and the service is great, but quite frankly, I come for the convenience.  The pancakes are good but they aren't the best I've had in London, which is why I haven't come here as often.  I am such a pancake lover and with this place down the street, it is tempting but the quality of the food, although quite tasty, doesn't compare to a couple other breakfast spots further away.  I love my pancakes fluffy and these are a bit flat.  But, this is a great spot and it's easy to get a table on a Sunday late morning without a reservation, so I definitely recommend it, particularly if you hate to queue!

HxcewtVdHvJBmstpMk-KuA.text: Location awesomeInterior really nice But really need to teach the cook how to cook very pricey for non quality food And poor service

OHCp1xCjcIDe_ATLlt10pQ.text: Over the course of a year I've been here 3-4 times. The food is totally fine. The one star is for the service which is absolutely terrible EVERY TIME. Wait at least 15-20 mins to order, then they are so slow with hot drinks that the food arrives first. Also, I'm normally in here when its half empty. I don't know why I gave it so many chances - clearly it will never improve!

sYQIPLTJEpPWIoyUeFk6vA.text: Food was very good (especially after dealing with hostel breakfasts) and the service was the best I have ever received in the UK!

0dchPlOrtzYd7E5oKqZBOA.text: Joe's Kitchen is a good place to grab a breakfast on a Saturday morning and get rid of the taste of Friday's beer. It is much more upmarket than your average greasy spoon with ample seating and clean tables.As I came for Yelp's Breakfast Club I saw the whole variety offered by the menu in addition to my bacon sandwich and orange juice. The service was great considering the staggered entrance of our group with each new addition to the table quickly served.I'll definitely make a return visit.

LmE2kO5Bc52pNPO1A6qmzQ.text: I had the humus for an appetizer and the chicken carbonara for my main. The humus was one of the best I have ever had and the chicken carbonara was delicious. Very different from Buca ;-)I highly recommend. Especially for Yanks.

k6I9TTERUG6gM8xiED-4-g.text: Went here on a Friday lunhtime. Pleasant service from bald Irish guy who recommended the Cafe Burger. Very nice indeed.Nicely lit, clean contemporary 'farmhouse' style decor. All dusty greens, brick and light oak furnature. Bustling with conversation, no music. Great selection of daily specials.A little expensive for lunch, but good grub and good service. Thumbs up.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Cafe Burger

eOnDXkefBH23Kt-bss9pDA.text: We went for a Full English breakfast the other day and I really liked it... the place and the food. Lovely atmosphere, nice 60s soul music playing, and a great breakfast. Plenty of choice of sauces (english&french mustards, HP sauce, ketchup, chutney...), nice cooked eggs and great toast. I also loved the americano coffee, very tasty.Bad point, they advertise on the website a discount for Gatwick and Manchester based airline staff. When we presented the BAA Id card+airline ID, we found out they only do this discount in selected Joes Kitchen branches.... They should specify this info on the web.Overall, great start of the day and I will definitely go back (with or without discount)

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. joes americano
Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. all day breakfast

xn1v5_D2Q4L5viTglWbUJg.text: Cappuccino and hot chocolate were excellent.  Slightly disappointed by their pancakes - feels as if cake mix was used in lieu of genuine pancake batter, not to mention there was no syrup, a non-started for any American customer.  The decor feels like a New Yorker's interpretation of a mid-west home: a bit yuppy but nonetheless cozy.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict

Y0oMWpLHEuFsqB3AhAax6A.text: The best meal of the day, by far, is always brunch. It always reminds me of whole grain pancakes, natural maple syrup, bowls of freshly washed strawberries, blueberries, blackberries. sweet french toast, tart orange juice, and freshly roasted italian coffee. Yes, brunch is truly the best time to eat! I'm not going to lie. I'm also spoiled with brunch in the States, We know and love our brunch. English breakfast of sausage, ham (bacon), beans and toast is nice, once in a blue moon, but it's CRAP. Sorry British people, it's true. So you can imagine how happy I was to discover this gem in the middle of London. The worst part of this place was the wait. If we were a party of two, we could have been seated almost immediately. Larger parties have to wait. Super large parties are especially screwed. Call ahead!I ordered the veggie omelette. It was really nice. Tons of spinach, egg, mushrooms, herbs. And filling! I also had a nutella shake which was out of this world! My partner had a black coffee and English breakfast which was subpar. The coffee was weak and the breakfast hum drum. Go here for variety, not for ordinary meals!

ah77MP8AtoTsFgfZ37g3hQ.text: Visited Joe's for breakfast on Halloween. The place was designed accordingly and created a nice atmosphere for the customers. Their breakfast portions are huge and very delicious. I had the Fluffy pancakes toped with Maple Syrup and the Chip Butty both of which were delicious and filling.

9mLj6IywMjlsa8GRpusp1g.text: Our Saturday morning haven, Joe's Kitchen next to Borough tube is a real hidden treasure. Fresh fruit smoothies, laid back atmosphere and the weekend papers... perfect hangover remedies. The only place where I have ever seen Boiled Egg and Toast Soldiers on the menu, Joe's is total comfort food and so affordable. Try the fluffy pancakes with maple syrup or the Eggs Benedict... drool! London often has a bit of a caf culture about breakfast, more often than not the only place to get a decent fry up has plastic tables and laminate floors - shudder. Joe's will make all those bad memories of builder's tea and squeezy brown sauce bottles go away. My only complaint with Joe's is that they close early at 3pm on the weekends, a few times I've sadly stood outside, face pressed to the glass, mewling about how I slept in!

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. A toast army

yzZUkM2HuPC977wEyFqSWQ.text: Great big bright place. Right next to the tube station. Went there for a breakfast yelp date and was at a table of nine so I got to see lots of different selections from the menu. The french toast looked yummy, "the American breakfast"? I think, looked like a british fry up but with pancakes. awesome. Buckets of coffee, nice smoothies. They have a menu but they also have everything up on the wall and then some, so don't forget to look up.I ordered the eggs benedict with bacon. The sauce tasted like straight butter, which yes sounds amazing but I was hoping for a little more of the eggy taste that I'm used to. But still, great food. Lovely place to sit and chill with friends.

szSIMEw1U3gbpMG5wOG5xA.text: Joe's was definitely a tasty Sunday morning brunch spot. From the bites I sampled off my tablemates' breakfasts (which included the famed pancakes, among many other tasty delights,) I must say that my fruit, yogurt and granola order seemed to be the overall taste winner.I could definitely see Joe's as a perfect hangover breakfast spot as the menu was packed with solid classics and my coffee packed a caffeinated punch! I wasn't blown away (nope, not even by the pancakes... they were a bit dense for my liking...) but the staff, the service and the price was a-ok. I'll certainly come back to Joe's if I'm in the area for a market morning.

z8ly5e1BxfWuVk6_eQPCeA.text: For a brunch spot it's not the best, but Joe's does perfectly fine french toast and pancakes. I tend to go to brunch after a big night out so I look for a few key things. 1) Thick, buttery, slightly greasy comfort food, 2 ) water (and plenty of it), and 3) comfortable seating. Joe's had decent food (other than the sausages which tasted a bit off) but the water was slow in coming and the chairs were hard as nails. It also wasn't a thrilling rec when we left half our breakfasts uneaten as they just didn't work for the decadent brunch offering.Overall, I was say Larissa said it best when describing Joe's as "nice" but it's nothing special an dnot worth the journey if you have other options nearby.

Ks4WEJz2_zIDvCEcevUJQA.text: I learnt about this place through the Yelp website and decided to check it out myself as it had received some good reviews.  I got the french toast and my partner got Joe's Morning Fry up (bacon, beans, toast, sausages and eggs).  I got to steal her bacon and it was a good match with the french toast.I was pleased with the french toast.  Tasty and filling.  You get two large pieces - a nice crispy outside and you can add as much golden syrup as you like. (That is, English golden syrup - much more runny than the golden syrup I'm used to back in NZ, but more appropriate in this).Our coffees were ok, but there is room for improvement.  My flat white was really a latte and I was told that the Americano had too much water in it.The service was efficient, but not spectacular.  I think we got tricked into getting an extra hash brown with the fry-up.  As I had understood the server's explanation, we were just choosing between beans and hashbrown as an option for the meal itself, not selecting something extra.  (Or maybe I just hadn't had my coffee and I was confused?)The food is good enough for me to want to go back.  I liked the look of the pancakes ordered by the couple at the table over from us.  Also, the blackboard specials looked tempting (for instance - yorkshire pudding with sausages and onion gravy, served with bubble and squeak).

Ra-zFRj-sm6FRcr-O-4Iyg.text: The food was nice.The atmosphere was nice.The service was nice.But everything was just a bit, well, 'nice'.To put it another way: I'd go back if someone asked me to, or if perhaps I was looking for an all-day breakfast (but only until the place closes at 5:30pm during the week and until 2:30pm on the weekend, obviously), but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back to Joe's Kitchen on my own for any other reason.

UjoA_gF4Xw3eBsQ4fhMrpw.text: Conveniently located steps from the Borough tube stop, Joe's Kitchen is a place I had walked by countless times.  It wasn't until my female gym crew and I decided that a super intense Sunday CrossFit session demanded a post-sweating brunch date that I walked through it's automatic swishing doors.  The breakfast menu is solid, with options ranging from a Full English to American style fluffy pancakes.  All three of us had a hard time deciding what to order and I took the easy way out by opting for the American Breakfast special.  It was a genius move because it combined all of the things I was trying to choose between.  The extra large plate arrived with two eggs (I had my poached), 2 bacon rashers, a pancake with maple syrup, a small triangle hashbrown and 2 full size sausages.  Seriously.  Two sausages are a meal right there!  I couldn't even touch the second one, but I polished off everything else.  All this and a mocha made for a decadent brunch-time treat.  One of my fellow diners had the full English omelet, which is served open faced.  We hadn't seen anything like it before.   The other had a stack of pancakes with fruit.  We all left happy.  The only drawback was that our server forgot my mocha.  My friend was presented with her latte and we had to flag someone down to ask about my drink.  The waiter admitted he forgot to put in the order and apologised.  One of the girls said that it was probably going to be on the house because it took so long to arrive, but I reminded her that even though we were in a place with fluffy pancakes, we weren't in the States.  Of course it was on the check, but it was delicious, so I didn't really care.  I'm almost sorry I finally discovered Joe's because I can't stop going back!  Although it has only been twice for takeaway coffee, I know i will return for their chocolate and peanut butter shake...and more breakfast...

iTCu5Wc5qbIqQj2ltKOg5w.text: I get sad when people serve me nachos using flavored Doritos. I sit here really sad, Joe's Kitchen. When I order nachos I expect plain tortilla chips, not Doritos or some bootleg version of it. I guess the reason I am so annoyed is that the place has a very American-esque feel to it, with American menu items, like burgers, pancakes, and iced lemon iced tea. So I assumed that they would have a good handle on the nachos. Nope. They didn't. But I can't say it wasn't edible, because it was. It just was not right. The tortilla chips were flavored and they just didn't go well with the toppings. And there was a sweet after taste that seemed wrong. The peppers weren't hot in the least. Very disappointing. Yeah, I don't think this option was a winner.I think I should not have expected much from the nachos when I spied the bartender pouring out my lemon iced tea out of a Lipton bottle. For shame!  I was thinking someone had taken the time to brew the tea, drown a bucket of sugar and lemons in it and chill it. Sigh. Wishful thinking. They did pretty up my drink with some mint leaves and a lemon slice. At least the tea looked special even though it really wasn't.But the service was great: the servers were all attentive, food came out fast, reasonably priced for a sit down lunch. Worth trying again...maybe?

Kk2nvrP-xCC7LLtxKxfOxg.text: I routinely visit an office just around the corner, and have done for years. Despite that, this is the first time I've been here, and I honestly wish I'd been years earlier as I'm a fan. I only wanted something simple for lunch today, and Joe's certainly delivered. I had the brunch on the lunch menu which was basically a fry up with chips - but done really well.The rest of the menu looks excellent and I aim to be back to work my way through it all. Certainly I had a hard choice trying to work out what I wanted today from several excellent sounding options. As for today, the scrambled egg was perfect, as was the bacon and the chips (oh boy those chips). My only complaint was that the sausage was a smidge dried out. In all honestly, I like them leaning towards that way anyhow, so I still very much enjoyed it.Service was great, with everyone very friendly. I look forward to returning.

Bs5Ct3Tl3EZP1I_iAx_MVg.text: Stopped off at the restaurant for dinner and was quite disappointed. Although the ambiance was classy and original, the food was subpar... the chicken kebab plate has VERY dry couscous that was almost impossible to eat without a glass of water, the chicken was not cooked thoroughly and the sweet potato + red pepper soup was mediocre. They were kind enough to discount our meal yet we were disappointed in the overall experience and food. Probably not the best items on the menu in my opinion.

a5wSV2E6M8e7P1k0nFzINQ.text: Great place for a brunch just 5 minutes away from Borough Market and decent price. I went for the avocado over sourdough bread and added an egg and it was very good. Plenty of smoothies and juices but I think they could increase the range of the tea offer ( i.e. Redbush, lemon and ginger).

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom

4AWIME6m7FcwRdvz_aAlbQ.text: I've been here a few times and I have to say it is much better for lunch than breakfast/brunch. I've enjoyed the burger and a smoothie and it's good  value for money. However, the coffee is just terrible,  lukewarm milk with a slight flavour of coffee. I've ordered coffee here twice and fool me twice, shame on me. The breakfast food is okay, I ordered the huevos rancheros and it was honestly pretty average. My partner really enjoyed his waffles and sausage butty however. The atmosphere is nice, service good in my experiences and it's usually easy to find a table. Hence, if they fixed their coffee they would have got a higher rating

lrGB2h6nn6LL-J08DjGsEA.text: Came into Joe's for lunch in the middle of a long busy day. It did not disappoint. The food was delicious and the decor adorable. I tried the chicken skewers, which came with 3 sides - very filling and worth the price. Stop here for a cozy, relaxed meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Cozy space to dine

PbTvnaIW1DXqN8sbhOUIEA.text: This was one of our regular spot to come and eat anytime during the day. They have lots of space, large wooden tables to share a meal with the whole family or tiny ones to enjoy a tea by yourself.They do breakfast & brunch with pastries (but don't try croissant outside of France), any type of eggs, pancakes, cakes and porridge, bubble and squeak, bacon-ish things, chorizo pan hash, avocados... They also have a menu that change everyday with various english meals and a normal menu with burgers, pies (pretty good shepherd pie), sausage and mash, salads, sandwichs, pastas, soupes...Their food is generally good, with quality products but the service can be a bit messy as it is a large restaurant, very busy on weekends so prepare yourself to ask twice for your tea or wait a bit longer to get your eggs with THAT extra bacon!

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Eggy toast. Like the French "pain perdu". It comes with maple syrup and fresh fruits
Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Chorizo pan. Hot and spicy
Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. English breakfast

hxht1mAu4sQwQPFw_58Btg.text: The food was great! The staff was attentive and polite, however it took a long time for our starters and meals to come out to the table. I had the pan seared sea bass and my friend had the lamb koftas. The lamb dish was excellent! The sea bass was delicious, however the "risotto" was not what I'm used to from back in the states. It was (what seemed to be) regular rice, with a delicious taste (and was not creamy). I had the potato kale soup as a starter and that was awesome! If you want a delicious meal, I recommend eating here, but if you're in a rush, I don't recommend this place. It's easy to find, right up the street from St. Paul's Cathedral.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Cappuccino
Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Cute decor
Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Kale and potato soup

Ga6LglxLzQABajP7jvVZkQ.text: We found another place for breakfast, but they were closed for August vacation.  So we wandered around and found Joe's.  Perfectly fine meal in a lovely atmosphere.  Great service, and a fine menu.

LCB7jUmfkP9r30KAWR07Qg.text: This was the first breakfast place we tried during our stay in London, and it was great! The server was very friendly and the food was delicious.

1J7tumwswNeGvQZ_bQBHCA.text: Joe's Kitchen is a proper brunch place around Borough, which is rare and hard to find as an American student. I also like a variety of drinks offered, and the staff are very friendly to me.

TLvMtATyPrkKQVvnzzw0cg.text: I stayed at st.christopher's hostel while I was visiting London, and this was my all to favorite place to eat. The English breakfast tea & macaroni and cheese was the best I've ever had in my life. When I come back to London, I will come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Yummy breakfast!
Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Salmon Benedict- the sauce is pretty heavy
Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. The best macaroni and cheese of my life

o_z8cxmazXmOFCfEkx1sBA.text: We came here after trying to get a table at The Table Cafe. It was pretty busy on a Sunday around 11am. The service and food were both ok. I ordered the Full Works Omelette and a latte. The omelette was decent but maybe not the most aesthetically pleasing brunch item.Not sure I would return but it's a cute place. If you're looking for average breakfast fare, Joe's Kitchen is the spot.

3eMB1npc7Obdu3HrFYoXPQ.text: Clean comfortable environment. Friendly staff very attentive. Eggs Benedict, pancakes hievos rancheros all get high grades. Fruit was fresh and coffee good too. We will be back for sure.

NCFwm2-TDb-oBQ2medmYDg.text: A fantastic delish breakfast at Joe's Kitchen. Joe's should be thanking Yelp for the business, because I would NEVER have found this place without the Yelp reviews and the recent Elite event.No queue when I arrived, I was brought to a table in the corner where I could easily see the specials board. I opted to go with one of those rather than the menu items. Stacked poached eggs and a piece of grilled bacon (we Americans would call it a ham steak) on top of bubble & squeak (no American equivalent) and a generous pouring of Hollandaise on top. Check the picture! A very good and very large skinny latte went with it.Unlike last week's breakfast place, Joe's is an organized and professional restaurant. No kitchy tables and chairs, everything here is matching soft woods and neatly dressed staff. The staff had a serious hustle going on - lots of movement with drinks and smoothies organized by one team and the plated food operated by another. I wasn't rushed at all - when the time came to pay my check, the waiter brought the credit card machine without being asked.There are two very large chalkboards with the specials neatly written. I was tempted by the "American brekkie with pancake eggs bacon sausage hash browns" and "Waffles w fruit salad" as well as "Eggs florentine" on one list and a list of drinks on the other - pink lemonade or  vanilla caramel smoothie. All of it sounded interesting and creative. And yummy.No wifi in the place, which was unfortunate. I did manage to grab a free paper from one of the displays in front of the nearby Tube station. While the place is a few steps up from street level, they have an internal lift for wheelchairs.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Joe's kitchen
Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Specials board
Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Poached eggs, bubble & squeak

uNqRjlaPiCncWzgYojg80w.text: As any American in London will tell you, it's really hard to find a proper brunch on this side of the pond. Joe's isn't perfect, but it's about as good as it gets in London.I came here on a Sunday morning with a family friend and we were seated relatively quickly, despite the packed house. The atmosphere is warm, welcoming, and homey. I was pleasantly surprised by the large serving sizes. Outrageous amounts of food are a hallmark of American brunch cuisine. I ordered a stack of fruit pancakes, 2 eggs scrambled, and a side of bacon and could barely finish it. I ended up taking most of the eggs and bacon home for brunch part 2 ;)If I have American friends coming into town (or if I can't ignore my brunch cravings any longer) I will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Side of scrambled eggs and bacon
Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Pancakes with strawberries, blueberries, and bananas

4spbDxjEiP5tbNMi1y_ypw.text: I've just been for brunch with my friends and I need to give 5 stars to this place!The location is perfect and lovely, the service it's amazing! We asked for a table outside but then the weather changed and we asked to be move inside and the waitress she was super kindly with us.The food is really good, I had fresh orange juice and scramble eggs on toast with bacons. But I'm really keen to come back for try pancakes :)

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom

rJuJcuf0Ufn-8wchhqwUag.text: Yep, I went again last weekend. It was really good, and quite busy also.I had the Cafe Breakfast, essentially a fryup and chips on the side as i was, rather famished.Around 12ish it got really busy so if you really wanna go, then perhaps dont chance it. Hmm..I wonder if you can book. I'll find out!

gz22sVCykAHIfCd5swP3jw.text: I frequented here, far too much during my time doing jury service. I usually got to London too early for court, so i took a stroll down borough high street, stop off here, and then stroll down to court, grabbing a coffee from the UBER nice italian cafe (more about that later!), and then sit in court/jury room being bored to tears.Joe's kitchen is a fairly modern quiet cafe off borough station, and service is pretty quick.In the two weeks, I've tried french toast with bacon-see pic and IT WAS GINORMOUS. I couldn't finish it. I have also tried their eggs on toast-both scambled and poached. It wasn't bad but poached egg-smelt VEERRRY vinegary but taste was fine, scrambled-I'm quite a slow eater so, by the time I got halfway, eggs were cold and rubbery. :(BUT the sausage butties are SO tasty. Go for that, even if it is a bit expensive for greasy caff food, but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. French toast with maple syria

XSls_pfOcJSMJ-LLgtvbkQ.text: Local food, bustling but cosy environment, loads of yummy sounding choices for meat and veggie palates. All kinds of coffee, smoothies and interesting alternatives. Gotta go, my pan hash has arrived :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Cappuccino. Large.
Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Hummus avocado and tomato "salsa" although it isn't really, and sourdough bread. A St Clements and a soy cappuccino
Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Soy cappuccino

9_PrVAZ0vawoJO2aXF3LmA.text: I recently spent 6 weeks in London for work and as a North American abroad (i'm both Canadian & American), I struggled to find a decent brunch spot. Even trusty Yelp didn't have much in the way of recommendations, but Joe's had enough reviews, and many positive, for me to give it a whirl. All in all, i'd say it was "meh." I walked in from the rain and asked for a table for 1 and was told it'd be about 10 minutes. I said, "that's fine. Can I order a coffee somewhere?" Nope. You can't order coffee until you sit down at the table. What is that about? If I have to wait for a table, wouldn't they WANT to sell me something to get me started just to ensure I don't leave? Guess not. And I did contemplate leaving after they told me that, but I had already made the trek, so I was pot committed. The restaurant itself is a nice decor and there's a good amount of bustle on a Sunday. I ordered the Veggie Brekkie for 7.75, which is unusual for me because I'm a carnivore, but it sounded interesting, primarily because it featured Bubble and squeak, a weird mish-mash of veggies that winds up being like vegetable mashed potatoes. Also had two eggs - fried or scrambled, roasted yellow and red peppers, tomato, flat mushroom and skin-on-fries. They had decent coffee served in large mugs, which was nice, and I had a good seat by the window. The service was attentive enough, though not overly so, and friendly. The food was a bit bland. I don't know, I guess I'd say if you've got a hankering for breakfast food & happen to be in the area, you might as well stop in, but I wouldn't go out of my way...

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Kitchen - Borough, London, United Kingdom. Cozy Sunday morning sanctuary...
